verb.description: Cause (something) to occur in a particular way; be the decisive factor in.
examples: it will be her mental attitude that determines her future

verb.description: Ascertain or establish exactly, typically as a result of research or calculation.
examples: the point of our study was to determine what is true, not what is practicable
officials are working with state police to determine the cause of a deadly bus crash
he determined on a withdrawal of his forces
she determined to tackle Stephen the next day

verb.description: Bring or come to an end.

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French determiner, from Latin determinare limit, fix, from de- completely + terminare terminate.
